Fourteen - year - old Allie Swann was having up to 100 seizures per day that years of treatments , including surgery to remove part of her brain , and debilitating drugs had not helped .
She was on the same stuff they use for lethal injections in Alabama , her father , Butch Swann , said .

Like 115 other marijuana refugee families , as they call themselves , from 43 states , they left family , jobs and homes so they could try oil made from a special strain of cannabis that reportedly quelled the seizures in a handful of kids in Colorado Springs .
